title: MDX Example - Interactive Components
summary: Demonstrating MDX capabilities with React components

body.raw:
# MDX Example - Interactive Components This post demonstrates the power of MDX by including interactive React components directly in the content. ## Interactive Counter Here's a simple counter component embedded directly in the markdown: ```jsx import { useState } from 'react' function Counter() { const [count, setCount] = useState(0) return (

Count: {count}

) } ``` ## Custom Styled Block You can also create custom styled content blocks:

ðŸ’¡ Pro Tip

MDX allows you to mix Markdown with React components seamlessly!

## Code with Live Preview You can even include live code examples: ```jsx function HelloWorld({ name = "World" }) { return

Hello, {name}!

} ``` ## Regular Markdown Still Works - **Bold text** - *Italic text* - [Links](https://example.com) - `Inline code` > Blockquotes work perfectly fine too! ## Conclusion MDX gives you the best of both worlds: the simplicity of Markdown with the power of React components.
